subject: Re: [junit] test method with arguments?
msgSnippet: ... No need to add hooks . Here is a simple example. public void testIndexOf() { assertEquals(-1, hello .indexOf( d )); } -- J. B. Rainsberger, Diaspar
messageBody:
javayang@... wrote:

> Is it possible to write a test method that accepts arguments? How do
> I change add the hooks to the framework so these methods get call?

No need to "add hooks". Here is a simple example.

public void testIndexOf() {
assertEquals(-1, "hello".indexOf("d"));
}
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
Let's write software that people understand
